title: Program
description: A schema describing startup, cloud credit, or similar programs.

draft.description: When true, indicates that this program entry is in draft mode and not yet published.

provider_slug.description: A short lowercase slug for the program's provider, e.g. aws, digitalocean, etc.

title.description: The official name or title of the program.

meta_title.description: An optional meta title for SEO or marketing purposes.
examples: Up to 6 months free with unlimited AI - Over $6,000 in savings

intro.description: A concise introduction or summary highlighting the main offer and value of the program.
examples: Get up to €36,000 cost-coverage for cloud services with free consulting support from solution architects and access to a 800+ startup community
Receive up to 20 seats of GitHub Enterprise free for 12 months, along with tailored guidance and DevOps best practices.
Notion helps startups stay organized and scale faster by offering up to 6 months of free usage, including unlimited AI features, for eligible teams under 50 employees with under $10M in funding.

description.description: A more detailed description of the program, covering its purpose, benefits, and scope.
examples: Time-limited cloud partnership program offering infrastructure credits, technical guidance, and community benefits for European startups at different growth stages. Participants gain access to Scaleway's partner ecosystem with over €250,000 in value.

GitHub for Startups supports early-stage companies by providing free GitHub Enterprise seats for a year, personalized onboarding, extensive DevOps automation, and access to the world's largest open source community. Eligible startups can accelerate their software development, manage projects, automate CI/CD workflows, and keep code secure on GitHub's trusted platform.

status.description: Indicates whether the program is currently Active, has been Discontinued, is in Beta, or is Upcoming.

tags.description: Up to five descriptive tags or keywords for the program.

url.description: The primary URL where users can learn more about or apply to the program.

value_type.description: Specifies whether this program provides credits (monetary value) or a discount percentage.

currency.description: Currency code used if the program provides monetary credits or discounts (e.g., USD or EUR).

min_value.description: Optional minimum credits or discount level. Useful when the program range starts at a certain value.

max_value.description: Maximum credits or discount value available through the program.

community_notes.description: Optional short collection of up to three community-provided notes or references.

title.description: A title summarizing the community note or reference.

body.description: The detailed body or explanation of the note.

source_url.description: An external link or source reference for further reading.

tiers.description: A list of tiers within the program, each describing a unique level of benefits, eligibility, and steps to apply.

name.description: The official or descriptive name of this tier.

intro.description: A short description of what this tier offers or requires.
examples: For youngest projects launching in startup-friendly environment with initial cloud cost coverage
Eligible startups get 20 seats of GitHub Enterprise free for 12 months.
For affiliated early-stage startups with fewer than 50 employees and under $10 million in accredited funding.

max_value.description: The maximum credits or discount percentage available at this tier.

url.description: A URL leading to more information or an application page for this tier.

benefits.description: List of key benefits for this specific tier, up to five items.
examples: Technical content library and scaling resources
Access to Scaleway community Slack channel (800+ members)
Up to 20 seats of GitHub Enterprise
Free Notion usage for up to 6 months

benefits_level.description: A rating from 1 to 4 indicating the relative depth or significance of the tier's benefits.

duration.description: One or more statements about how long the tier's benefits last (e.g., '12 months'). Maximum of five items.

eligibility.description: Up to five bullet points explaining who qualifies for this tier.
examples: Haven't previously received GitHub Enterprise credits

effort_level.description: A rating from 1 to 4 reflecting how much work or complexity is required for this tier.

steps_to_apply.description: A step-by-step guide on how to apply for this tier, if applicable.

name.description: Name or short label for the step.

description.description: A detailed explanation of what the applicant must do in this step.

action.description: Optional call to action label or a short imperative describing the step (e.g., 'Sign Up').

action_url.description: Optional URL to complete the step (e.g., a form or signup page).

examples.name: Create Scaleway Account
examples.description: Scaleway can't process your application without an account

examples.name: Complete Application Form
examples.description: Fill out the application form (~15 minutes)

examples.name: Check eligibility
examples.description: Ensure your startup meets all requirements (outside funding up to Series A, new to GitHub Enterprise).

examples.name: Submit application
examples.description: Fill out the GitHub for Startups application form to get started.

examples.name: Complete Application
examples.description: Fill out the online form verifying your eligibility and partner affiliation

faq.description: A list of frequently asked questions with corresponding answers regarding the program.

question.description: A question commonly asked by potential participants or users.

answer.description: The official or recommended answer to the question.

examples.question: What is the Scaleway Startup Program?
examples.answer: A time-limited cloud partnership program providing infrastructure credits and technical assistance. Participants leverage Scaleway's public cloud infrastructure along with advisory resources and community support.

examples.question: Who can apply to the program?
examples.answer: Scaleway accepts applications from startups at any stage. The admission committee prioritizes projects demonstrating innovative use of cloud infrastructure.
